item.title: Beautiful Math in SICP Part-1
item.description: Square roots by Newton's Method \[\sqrt x = \text{the } y \text{ such that } y \geq 0 \text{ and } y^2 = x\] The above definition is a valid way of defining square-root. But how do we tell the computer to calculate it? We Use Newton's method of successive approximations. The algorithm is as follows:- We start by guessing the \(\sqrt x\) is \(y\). Now we check how close the square of the \(y\) is to \(x\).
